thread.title: PREP FOOTBALL PREVIEW: Playoff picture clearing up for Cullman as matchup with No. 4 Muscle Shoals looms
thread.title_full: PREP FOOTBALL PREVIEW: Playoff picture clearing up for Cullman as matchup with No. 4 Muscle Shoals looms

author: jwinfrey@cullmantimes.com(Jake Winfrey)
title: PREP FOOTBALL PREVIEW: Playoff picture clearing up for Cullman as matchup with No. 4 Muscle Shoals looms
text:
by Jake Winfrey 
There’s no doubt Cullman has its hands full tonight against undefeated Muscle Shoals. 
The Bearcats (6-2, 3-2 in Class 6A, Region 8) will play host to the No. 4 Trojans (8-0, 5-0) with a chance to garner a playoff spot for the first time since 2013. 
Here’s how things could shake out with Hartselle-Austin and Florence-Decatur also set to face off: 
% A win against Muscle Shoals combined with losses by Hartselle and Decatur would earn Cullman the No. 2 seed. 
% A loss to Muscle Shoals combined with wins by Austin and Decatur would earn Cullman the No. 4 seed. 
% A loss to Muscle Shoals combined with wins by Austin and Florence would eliminate Cullman from postseason play. 
% Any other variation of wins and losses would earn Cullman the No. 3 position in Region 8. 
In the meantime, the Bearcats can forego those scenarios by defeating Muscle Shoals inside Oliver Woodard Stadium. 
The Black and Gold are 7-6 all-time against the Trojans but have lost four straight in the series by a total margin of 145-33. 
I think Muscle Shoals evens things up and makes Cullman rely on help from other schools. 
% Jake’s Pick: Muscle Shoals 
% Rob’s Pick: Muscle Shoals 
Southeastern (1-7, 0-5 in 2A, R6) at Addison (4-4, 2-3) 
The Bulldogs took care of their business last week, clinching their sixth straight playoff berth with a 28-22 win over Tarrant in a double-overtime road thriller. 
Tonight’s matchup should be over before the second quarter, because a bad Mustang squad won’t stand in the way of an Addison victory. 
Southeastern has lost six straight and has been outscored 309-13 in that miserable stretch. 
The Bulldogs should be able to name the score, shore up some schemes on both sides of the ball and rest key players in the second half. 
Should. 
% Rob’s Pick: Addison 
Cold Springs (5-3, 3-2 in 2A, R6) at Tarrant (1-7, 1-4) 
Like their region counterpart above, the Eagles garnered a playoff berth in Region 6 following a ho-hum 42-14 triumph against Sumiton Christian. 
And, just like Addison, Cold Springs should be able to use tonight’s tilt as nothing more than a scrimmage to pad the stats, fine tune whatever it needs and seal the deal by halftime. 
Tarrant doesn’t have a very efficient offense and can’t stop a nosebleed on defense. 
Don’t believe me? Look at what the Wildcats have given up their past four games. 50, 56, 30, 28. 
The Eagles should be able to up that average. 
% Jake’s Pick: Cold Springs 
% Rob’s Pick: Cold Springs 
North Jackson (5-3, 5-1 in 4A, R7) at Good Hope (2-6, 1-5) 
The Raiders are tumbling. 
The Chiefs are rising. 
Good Hope has dropped three straight contests — being outscored by a robust 108-28 margin over that stretch — and has to deal with a seriously underrated North Jackson squad that seems to be hitting its stride. 
After dropping three of their first five games, the Chiefs have reeled off three consecutive wins and have scored at least 44 points in each outing. 
That spells bad news for a struggling Raider defense. 
North Jackson won last year’s game 62-14 in the lone meeting between the two programs. 
% Jake’s Pick: North Jackson 
% Rob’s Pick: North Jackson 
Holly Pond (0-8, 0-5 in 3A, R5) at Winfield (7-1, 5-0) 
The past two Friday’s have been simply heartbreaking for the Broncos. 
After surrendering a late touchdown to Vinemont in a 29-25 affair, they blew a 20-point lead versus Hanceville en route to 60-50 defeat last week. 
Twenty-eight losses and counting. 
It won’t get any easier tonight, either. 
Holly Pond travels to face No. 10 Winfield, which has won seven bouts in a row by an average of 23.5 points per game. 
Unfortunately, I think the Green and White’s best chance for a win has already come and gone. 
% Jake’s Pick: Winfield 
% Rob’s Pick: Winfield 
Winston County (5-3, 2-3 in 3A, R5) at Vinemont (1-7, 1-4) 
The Eagles’ dream of a second straight playoff appearance officially ended after a road loss to Susan Moore last Friday. 
Now, it’s all about playing for pride. 
Vinemont will look to send its seniors out with one more region triumph as the Yellow Jackets buzz into town tonight. 
Although Winston County has been up and down this season, the Eagle nation will need to turn out a sensational showing in order to come away with the upset. 
Can they? Absolutely. 
Will they? It’ll be tough. 
% Jake’s Pick: Winston County 
% Rob’s Pick: Winston County 
Cullman Christian (7-0) at Marion Academy (3-3) 
The Lions enter tonight’s game undefeated on the season. 
They’ve tallied 293 points and yielded just 37 en route to a perfect start. 
Take the hint, Panthers. 
% Jake’s Pick: Cullman Christian 
% Rob’s Pick: Cullman Christian 
West Point (4-4, 3-3 in 5A, R8) at Lawrence County (4-4, 3-3) 
Check out Thursday’s Times or visit www.cullmantimes.com for an in- depth look at this crucial region matchup. 
% Jake’s Pick: West Point 
% Rob’s Pick: West Point 
Susan Moore (3-5, 3-2 in 3A, R5) at Hanceville (3-5, 3-2) 
Pick up a copy of Thursday’s Times or visit www.cullmantimes.com to take in a preview of this pivotal region game. 
% Jake’s Pick: Hanceville 
% Rob’s Pick: Susan Moore 
% Jake’s Record to Date: 51-16 
% Rob’s Record to Date: 51-16
